channel.title: New Jagex Pictures
channel.description:
They added a new section to their corporate website. If you haven't seen this already:
[img]http://server.sparkware.net/~jonny/jagex/office1.jpg[/img] [img]http://server.sparkware.net/~jonny/jagex/office2.jpg[/img] [img]http://server.sparkware.net/~jonny/jagex/office3.jpg[/img] [img]http://server.sparkware.net/~jonny/jagex/office5.jpg[/img] [img]http://server.sparkware.net/~jonny/jagex/office6.jpg[/img]
I found this one particularly interesting. Looks like their world building tool, notice the (top down?) display on the left and the 3D preview display on the top right.
If you look at the contents of some of the other screens, I think I can see an interface designer, and a modeling tool (farthest left on the first image).
Thoughts?

I trust the source. And there is a resemblance to a picture of him that I’ve seen before.

And the reflection in his DS, i don’t doubt it.[/quote]
Actually I was referring to a picture that he had on a chat client back in the day.

item.title: New Jagex Pictures
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

http://jagex.com/corporate/Jobs/Technologies/Senior_Tools_Developer.ws

Essential requirements:

[ul][li]High-level knowledge of Java and C++;[/li]
[li]High-level knowledge of object-oriented programming techniques;[/li]
[li]Strong understanding and appreciation of code design philosophies;[/li]
[li]Strong academic background at degree level or equivalent;[/li]
[li]Good industry track record, which may include previously published products, or tools development experience;[/li]
[li]The ability to think creatively to solve coding problems;[/li]
[li]Demonstrable high degrees of initiative, determination and flexibility.[/li][/ul]

Not to mention some pictures from their older dev blogs which show some of their tools. They could have been created in Java, but I find it unlikely.

Read full topic

item.title: New Jagex Pictures
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Haha. Btw, Mark has a rather interesting resume:

Mark Gerhard’s Experience

Chief Executive Officer
Jagex
(Privately Held; Computer Games industry)
January 2009 — Present (9 months)
Jagex Games Studio home town is Cambridge, England. Jagex is the UK’s largest independent games developer and publisher not to mention the most awesome. Jagex specialises in thin client browser-based games which basically means we can do stuff in a browser nobody else can do
The flagship game is RuneScape, which is one of the most successful massive multiplayer online games (MMOG’s) , with over 10m active players worldwide. Jagex’s aim is to provide triple-A multi-player games free.

Chief Technical Officer
Jagex
(Privately Held; Computer Games industry)
February 2008 — January 2009 (1 year)
Security Architect
GTECH
(Public Company; 5001-10,000 employees; GTK; Information Technology and Services industry)
October 2007 — January 2008 (4 months)
Chief Technical Officer
Ministry of Data
(Privately Held; 51-200 employees; Computer & Network Security industry)
November 2004 — October 2007 (3 years)
Group Systems Manager
Sterling Relocation
(Privately Held; 201-500 employees; Transportation/Trucking/Railroad industry)
September 2002 — November 2004 (2 years 3 months)
Chief Operating Officer
Serious
(Privately Held; 51-200 employees; Music industry)
July 2000 — April 2002 (1 year 10 months)
Principal Consultant
Chromasonic Computer Centre Ltd
(Privately Held; 51-200 employees; Computer & Network Security industry)
June 1999 — July 2000 (1 year 2 months)
IT Director
Hospital I.T. Solutions (Pty) Ltd
(Privately Held; 5001-10,000 employees; Computer Software industry)
January 1999 — May 1999 (5 months)
Security Consultant
Rand Merchant Bank
(Public Company; 1001-5000 employees; RMH; Banking industry)
October 1998 — December 1998 (3 months)

He held 7 jobs before working as Jagex Chief Technical Officer and 3 of those jobs were for less than 12 months; he’s gotten around.

Read full topic

item.title: New Jagex Pictures
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Here’s some more pictures for everyone to take a geez at. Out of the office and into party mode.

Chief Financial Officer Riaan Hodgson is the guy in the car behind the two ladies.

Mark Gerhard and Paul are the two on the left. Andrew has his arms folded (standing closer to the camera than the other guy with long hair and his arms folded), and the guy to the far right is Zezima.

[hr]

And just for discussion’s sake:

http://jagex.com/corporate/Jobs/Technologies/Senior_Tools_Developer.ws

Senior Tools Developer Jagex Games Studio, developers and publishers of the hugely successful MMORPG, RuneScape, are looking for bright and passionate programmers who want to work with cutting-edge technology, to join our Game Engine/Tools department.

Joining the Jagex Technologies team, you would be developing new in-house tools to support our content development and graphics teams, while also working with our code libraries, scripting language and game engine.

Key duties include:
Develop and maintain bespoke content creation tools to the highest standards, using Java;
Enhance and improve the game engine;
Research new technology, platforms, techniques and ideas;
Enhance both the Tools and Game Engine libraries;
Act as lead on projects, overseeing design and development.

Essential requirements:
High-level knowledge of Java and C++;
High-level knowledge of object-oriented programming techniques;
Strong understanding and appreciation of code design philosophies;
Strong academic background at degree level or equivalent;
Good industry track record, which may include previously published products, or tools development experience;
The ability to think creatively to solve coding problems;
Demonstrable high degrees of initiative, determination and flexibility.

Also useful:
Knowledge of other platforms including, but not limited to, Mac OS, Linux, Wii, PS3 and Xbox;
Good understanding of GUIs and tools;
Experience of working on networked and MMO games;
Experience as a lead programmer.

http://jagex.com/corporate/Jobs/Technologies/Game_Engine_Developer.ws

Game Engine Developer Jagex Games Studio, developers and publishers of the hugely successful MMORPG, RuneScape, are looking for exceptional, passionate programmers who want to work with cutting edge technology, to join our Game Engine/Tools department.

Joining the Jagex Technologies team, you would be working with our code libraries, scripting language and game engine technologies. We are looking for people who have excelled in the field of computer programming to join our fast-paced team, with successful candidates being proficient in all aspects of programming and also able to code in a succinct manner.

This is an exciting opportunity for a candidate with ambition and initiative to join a fast-paced, rapidly expanding online games company and help us achieve our ambitious goals for 2009 and beyond.

Key duties include:
Programming, using Java and C++, to service assigned and scheduled requests for new and enhanced technology in a flexible and fast-paced environment;
Researching, innovating and developing new game engine technology;
Enhancing and maintaining our existing game engine technology;
Working to keep our industry-leading technology ahead of the competition;
Constantly being pro-active in finding ways to make our game technology faster, slimmer and more effective.

Essential requirements:
Extremely proficient at using Java or C++;
Good knowledge of code design;
Knowledge of Windows OS or another main OS or platform;
Good knowledge of OpenGL, DirectX and 3D rendering;
Experience developing programs to a high standard in a commercial environment;
Relevant qualification at degree level or equivalent.

Also useful:
Experience of working on networked and MMO games;
Industry experience, including sandwich years, summer placements or freelance work;
Knowledge of other platforms including but not limited to Mac OS, Linux, Wii, PS3 and X-box.

Did speculation about precisely which languages they use for their other technology ever end? If not then I’d conclude that at least some of their services are dependent on C++.

Read full topic
